Package ch.idsia.crema.inference.sepolyve

Class SePolyVE

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.idsia.crema.inference.sepolyve.SePolyVE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Inference<GraphicalModel<VertexFactor>,​VertexFactor>
    public class SePolyVE
extends Object
implements Inference<GraphicalModel<VertexFactor>,​VertexFactor>
    Precise Separately specified polytree inference algorithm.

    During the execution the algorithm collects stats about vertices and timings.

    The algorithm supports HARD limints on memory usage and execution time. Reaching such a limit will trigger a runtime exception.

    Author:
    david huber, Alessandro Antonucci, Jasper De Bock

    • Method Detail

      • getOrder

        public ArrayList<Integer> getOrder()

      • init

        public void init​(Map<String,​?> params)
        Initialize the algorithm with limits. Supported keys are:
        • MAX_MEM_BYTE: approximate max memory usage in bytes
        • MAX_TIME_MS: max execution time in milliseconds
        Values may be expressed as strings or numerics.

        NOTE: a call to init is not required for the algorithm to function!

        Parameters:
        params - a map with initialization options (can be NULL)

      • query

        public VertexFactor query​(GraphicalModel<VertexFactor> model,
                          gnu.trove.map.TIntIntMap evidence,
                          int query)
        Compute the marginal or posterior probability of query given evidence in the model.
        Specified by:
        query in interface Inference<GraphicalModel<VertexFactor>,​VertexFactor>
        Parameters:
        model - the model to use for inference
        query - the variable that will be queried
        evidence - the observed variable as a map of variable-states
        Returns:
        the posterior or marginal extensive VertexFactor
        Throws:
        MaxTimeException - - when maximum execution time is reached
        MaxMemoryException - - when maximum memory usage is reached
